# Thank you for your interest!

Thank you for your interest in the Fluke SMFT-1000 Solar Tools Kit. A Fluke representative will contact you shortly.

As a professional in the clean energy industry, staying informed about the latest tools, technologies, and best practices is crucial. That's why we've prepared this comprehensive kit to help you streamline your workflow, ensure the safety and efficiency of your projects, and certify your PV systems.

Here's a taste of what you can expect:

- Learn about the comprehensive features of the Fluke SMFT-1000 Solar Tools Kit and how it can enhance your clean energy projects.
- Understand how the SMFT-1000 can help you verify performance, ensure safety, and certify PV systems during installation, commissioning, and maintenance.
- Explore the benefits of the TruTest™ Solar Data Management Software and how it can streamline your reporting process.
- Discover how the SMFT-1000 can help you save time and reduce errors with its "Keep the Leads" system and Auto Test Mode.

We're thrilled to have you on board for this insightful journey into clean energy efficiency. Please visit our [Fluke Solar Industry Tools](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/products/electrical-testing/best-solar-energy-industry-tools) page to learn what other solutions could be right for you.

# General Services Administration (GSA) Contracts for Calibration Equipment

A Fluke Calibration product adds value and capacity to your calibration laboratory for many years to come. Get the equipment you need, quickly and easily through the Fluke Calibration GSA program. GSA saves you time and money because product comparisons have already been done and pricing has already been negotiated.

Products covered include:

## Electrical calibrators and standards

[A40B Series Precision Current Shunts](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/a40b)

[720A Kelvin-Varley Divider](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/720a)

[734A Reference and Transfer Standards](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/732c-734c)

[742A Resistance Standards](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/742a)

[752A Reference Divider](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/752a)

[792A AC/DC Transfer Standard](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/792a)

[5080A Multi-Product Calibrator](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-calibrators/5080a)

[52120A Transconductance Amplifier](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-calibrators/52120a)

[5320A Electrical Tester Calibrator](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-calibrators/5320a)

[5502A Multi-Product Calibrator](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-calibrators/5502a)

[5522A Multi-Product Calibrator](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-calibrators/5522a)

[5790B AC Measurement Standard](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/5790b)

[5901 Triple Point of Water Cells](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibration/its-90-temperature-standards/5901)

[8508A Reference Multimeter](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/bench-multimeters/8508a)

[8845A and 8846A Multimeter](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/precision-measurement/bench-instruments/fluke-8845a-8846a)

[910R GPS/Rubidium Frequency Reference](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-standards/910-910r)

[9500B Oscilloscope Calibrator](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-calibrators/9500b)

[9510, 9530, 9550, 9560 Active Heads for 9500B Calibrator](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/electrical-calibration/electrical-calibrators/9500b)

[96040A Low Phase Noise Reference Source](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/rf-calibration/96040a)

[96270A 27 GHz Low Phase Noise Reference Source](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/rf-calibration/96270a)

## Temperature calibrators and standards

[1594A/1595A Super-Thermometers](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibration/digital-thermometer-readouts/1594a-1595a)

[1620A DewK Thermo-Hygrometer](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-calibration-1620a)

[5610 Thermistor Probes](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-hart-secondary-thermistor-probes)

[5615 PRT Probe](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/accessories/temperature/5615)

[5616 PRT Probe](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/accessories/temperature-calibration/5616)

[5618 PRT Probe](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/accessories/temperature/5618b)

[5626/5628 Secondary SPRT, PRT, Temperature Sensors](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/accessories/temperature/5626-5628)

[5960A Triple Point of Argon System](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibration/its-90-temperature-standards/5960a)

[6020/6022/6024 High Temperature Calibration Oil Baths](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibration/calibration-baths/6020-series)

[73xx Baths](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibration/calibration-baths/7340-7380)

[7009/7108/7015 Resistor Baths](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibration/calibration-baths/7009-7108-7015)

[9009 Industrial Dual-Block Dry-Well](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-calibration-9009)

[9144 Field Metrology Wells](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-calibration-9144)

[9170 Series Metrology Wells](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-calibration-9170)

[9171 Series Metrology Wells](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-calibration-9171)

[9172 Series Metrology Wells](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-calibration-9172)

[9173 Series Metrology Wells](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/temperature-calibrators/fluke-calibration-9173)

[MET/Temp Software](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/fluke-software/fluke-calibration-software/met-temp-ii)

## Pressure and flow calibrators and standards

[6270A Pressure Controller/Calibrator »](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/calibration-tools/pressure-calibration/automated-pressure-controller-and-calibrators)

# HVAC Cooling Season Promotion

![Save 10% on Spring HVAC Saving](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/flk-210321-en-naam-HVAC-Cooling-Season-End-User-Promo-Web-Graphics-lp-968x194.jpg)

Purchase a Fluke [902FC HVAC Clamp Meter](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-902-fc), [116 HVAC Digital Multimeter](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/electrical-testing/digital-multimeters/fluke-116) or Amprobe [THWD-3 Temperature Humidity Meter](https://www.amprobe.com/product/thwd-3/ "(opens in a new window)") and receive a **FREE** [1AC-II Non-Contact Voltage Tester](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/electrical-testing/basic-testers/fluke-1ac-ii) or [TPAK ToolPak ™ Magnetic Meter Hanging Kit](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/product/accessories/magnetic-hangers-utility-tools/tpak?_ga=2.54588525.75723570.1619456121-158238127.1619021537)

Here’s how to redeem your free gift:

1. Purchase a Fluke 902FC, 116, or Amprobe THWD-3 from an authorized [Fluke HVAC distributor](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/Authorized-US-HVAC-Fluke-Distributors.pdf "(opens in a new window)") May 1-July 30.
2. Complete the redemption form and submit a copy of your invoice or receipt within 30 days of purchase. Select either the 1AC-II or TPAK for your free gift.
3. Your free gift will ship 6-8 weeks after submission of eligible redemption form. Proof of purchase must be an invoice or receipt. Limit one free gift per eligible unit purchased. See additional terms and conditions below.

[Complete your redemption](http://fluke.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_3wu3r1ZdWI3IbiK "(opens in a new window)")

Purchase Fluke and Amprobe tools from the authorized distributors below or listed [here](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/Authorized-US-HVAC-Fluke-Distributors.pdf "(opens in a new window)")

|     |     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [![Arh Supply](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/arc-suply-inc.jpg)](https://www.acrsupply.com/ "(opens in a new window)") | [![Service Supply](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/Service-Supply.jpg)](https://servicesupply.net/ "(opens in a new window)") | [![Young Supply Company](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/young-supply-company.jpg)](https://www.youngsupply.com/ "(opens in a new window)") | [![KTool](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/ktool.jpg)](https://www.ktool.net/ "(opens in a new window)") |

**Terms and Conditions**

Sponsored by Fluke Electronics Corporation, 6920 Seaway Boulevard, Everett, WA 98203. Qualifying Fluke purchase (902FC, 116, or THWD-3) made from an authorized Fluke distributor in the United States between May 1 and July 30, 2021. Limit one (1) free gift (Fluke 1AC or TPAK Meter Hanging Kit) per eligible unit purchased, per invoice or receipt submitted. Purchases orders are not eligible. This offer may not be combined with any current or future Fluke Corporation offers. Offer is open to legal U.S. residents and/or businesses currently residing or physically located in the United States and the District of Columbia. Void in Puerto Rico, all other U.S. territories and possessions and overseas military installations and where prohibited or otherwise restricted by law, rule or regulation. [See complete terms and conditions](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/HVAC-Cooling-Season-2021-Customer-Promotion-Terms-and-Conditions.pdf "(opens in a new window)")

# Fluke New Solar Product Giveaway

## TERMS AND CONDITIONS

01. **Promotion Description**

     Eligible customers who participate in this Fluke Industry Leading eMobility product giveaway (the “Promotion”) during the Promotion Period (as defined in Section 3) and meet all the requirements as set forth in these terms and conditions of the Promotion are eligible to win either the new EV charging station maintenance tool as further described below or one of four (4) Fluke TB25 Tool Buckets.



     Under the Promotion, eligible end customers of Fluke Electronics Corporation (“Sponsor”) who register to receive pre-launch updates and solar content will be entered into a drawing to win a new, to be released Fluke EV charging station maintenance product.

03. **Eligibility**

     For purposes of the Promotion, a customer must be at least 18 years of age, and a resident of the 50 United States or District of Columbia (excluding Puerto Rico).



     Only customers that are end-users and use solar and EVSE maintenance tools for their own purposes are eligible to participate in the Promotion. Distributors, resellers, and similar parties are expressly excluded from participation in the Promotion.



     Employees, directors and officers of the Sponsor, its parent companies, affiliated companies, subsidiaries, distributors, representatives, and those persons’ immediate families (parents, siblings, children, and spouse) and persons living in the same household (whether related or not) are not eligible to participate in the Promotion. Further, no employees, officers, directors, representatives, or agents of (i) government entities, including government owned or controlled companies, (ii) distributors or (iii) competing tool manufacturers are eligible to participate in the Promotion.

05. **Promotion Period**

     In order to qualify for the Promotion, an eligible customer must register to receive Fluke Solar and eMobility tool content and updates for the new, to be released product during the Promotion Period, which starts at 12:00 AM Pacific Standard Time on Thursday, May 2, 2024, and ends at 11:59 PM Pacific Time on Monday, May 27, 2024 (the “Promotion Period”).

07. **Instructions on How to Participate in the Promotion**

     In order to enter the giveaway drawing under the Promotion, all eligible customers must follow the process stated below during the Promotion Period.
    - Visit (Landing Page)
    - Enter your name and email address
    - Hit Submit
    - Receive pre-launch updates and exclusive eMobility content from Fluke

09. **Winner Selection and Notification**

     Within two weeks of the completion of the Entry Period, one (1) potential winner will be selected in a random drawing from all eligible entries received during the Entry Period. The drawing will be conducted by Fluke Corporation or its designated representatives, whose decisions are final.



     The potential winner will be notified by email within five (5) business days following the winner selection. Fluke Corporation shall have no liability for a winner's failure to receive notices due to spam, junk e-mail, or other security settings or for a winner’s provision of incorrect or otherwise non-functioning contact information.



     The potential winner must respond to the notification within seven (7) days of notification. Failure to respond within the designated timeframe may result in disqualification, and an alternate winner may be selected.

11. **Restrictions and Limitations of the Promotion**

     The Promotion is subject to all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations and is void where prohibited by law. The Promotion is also void in the United States territories and possessions and all other countries not listed in Section 2.



     At its sole discretion, Sponsor may offer to substitute a free product of equal or higher value if new, to be release product does not become available.



     No cash substitutes are allowed for any reason.

13. **Disclaimer**

     Sponsor and each of its parent companies, subsidiaries, and affiliates, and each of their respective directors, officers, equity owners, professional advisors, distributors, representatives, employees and agents (collectively, the “Released Parties”) will not be responsible or have any liability for: (a) any late, lost, misrouted, garbled or distorted or damaged communications, transmissions or requests; (b) telephone, electronic, hardware, software, network, Internet, or other computer- or communications-related malfunctions or failures; (c) any Promotion disruptions, injuries, losses or damages caused by events beyond the control of Sponsor or by non-authorized human or other intervention; or (d) any printing or typographical errors in any materials associated with the Promotion.

15. **Limitation of Liability**

     Except where otherwise prohibited by law, by participating in the Promotion, you release and agree to indemnify and hold harmless each Released Party from any liability, obligation, injury, claim, suit, action, cost, expense, loss or damage of any kind, including any tax liability or loss of opportunity, whether direct, indirect, special, incidental or consequential, that may be imposed on, asserted against or incurred by such Released Party that arise out of or relate in any way to this Promotion and the giveaway offered hereunder, including, but not limited to, where arising out of or relating to the following: (a) any technical difficulties or equipment malfunction (whether or not under Sponsor’s control); (b) any theft, unauthorized access or third party interference; (c) any tax liability incurred by participant; or (g) use or misuse of the product offered under the Promotion.

17. **Tax Liability**

     The winner of the new product Giveaway is solely responsible for any and all taxes associated with the receipt and use of the prize, including but not limited to federal, state, and local taxes.



     Fluke Corporation will provide the winner of the new product with an IRS Form 1099 reporting the value of the prize for tax purposes. The winner agrees to provide any necessary information to Fluke Corporation to facilitate compliance with tax reporting requirements.

19. **Opt Outs**

     If you have been selected as the winner of the Fluke New Solar Product Giveaway and wish to decline the prize, you must notify Fluke Corporation within seven (7) days of receiving the winner notification. To opt out of accepting the prize, please send an email to \[fluke-info@fluke.com\] with the subject line "Opt Out - Fluke Solar Product Giveaway." In your email, include your full name, contact information, and a statement expressing your decision to decline the prize.



     By opting out of accepting the prize, you acknowledge that you will forfeit any rights to the prize, and Fluke Corporation will proceed to select an alternate winner in accordance with the terms and conditions of the giveaway.



     Please note that once you have opted out and an alternate winner has been selected, you will not be eligible to receive the prize or any other compensation from Fluke Corporation in connection with the giveaway.



     If you do not notify us of your decision to opt out within the designated timeframe, you will be deemed to have accepted the prize, and you will be subject to all obligations and responsibilities associated with being the winner of the Fluke Corporation Product Giveaway.

21. **Miscellaneous**

     The Promotion and these terms and conditions will be governed, construed, and interpreted under the laws of the State of Washington, USA without applying any conflicts or choice of law provisions under such law that might refer the construction or interpretation of any term hereof to the laws of any other jurisdiction. Any action brought regarding the Promotion and these terms and conditions may only be brought in the state or federal courts located in the State of Washington, and each party to such action expressly consents to jurisdiction of those courts. If any provision of these terms and conditions is held illegal or unenforceable in a judicial proceeding, such provision shall be severed and shall be inoperative, and, provided that the fundamental terms and conditions of these terms and conditions remain legal and enforceable, the remainder of these terms and conditions shall remain operative and binding.



     The customer is bound by these terms and conditions and by the decisions of Sponsor, which are final and binding in all respects. To the extent permitted by law, Sponsor reserves the right to change these terms and conditions at any time, in its sole and absolute discretion, and to suspend or cancel the Promotion or any customer’s participation in the Promotion should technical failures, computer viruses, fraud, human error, unauthorized human intervention or other causes beyond Sponsor’s control affect the administration, security, proper functioning, integrity or conduct of the Promotion, Sponsor otherwise becomes (as determined in its sole and absolute discretion) incapable of conducting the Promotion as planned, or for any other reason determined by Sponsor to be appropriate in its sole and absolute discretion.



     These terms and conditions constitute the entire agreement governing the Promotion and binding the customer, and no other agreement, verbal or otherwise, shall be binding regarding the Promotion unless it is in writing and signed by Sponsor. In case of any conflict or inconsistency between any other documents relating to the Promotion and these terms and conditions, these terms and conditions shall control. To the maximum extent provided by law, no waiver of any provision of these terms and conditions will be implied from any course of dealings between the customer and Sponsor or from any failure by the customer or Sponsor to assert its rights hereunder on any occasion or a series of occasions. Eligibility to participate in the Promotion is non-transferable and non-assignable.



     Any customer who violates these terms and conditions, violates any law, rule or regulation in connection with participation in the Promotion, tampers with the operation of the Promotion, or engages in any conduct that is unsportsmanlike, disruptive, or detrimental or unfair to Sponsor, the Promotion or any other participant (in each case as determined in Sponsor’s sole and absolute discretion) are subject to disqualification from participation in the Promotion and all other rights and remedies available under the law.



     Sponsor’s use of the customer’s personal information provided to Sponsor is subject to Sponsor's Privacy Policy (available at http://en-us.fluke.com/site/privacy). If you have any questions about these terms and conditions or the Promotion, please email them to fluke-info@fluke.com or send written questions to the address: ATTN: Fluke Solar Product Giveaway Team 6920 Seaway Blvd., Everett, WA 98203.

23. **Sponsor’s Address Information**

     Fluke Electronics Corporation, 6920 Seaway Blvd., Everett, WA 98203. Fluke

25. **Copyright Notice**

     The Promotion and all accompanying materials, including these terms and conditions, are copyright © 2024 by Fluke Corporation. All rights reserved.

# How to avoid buying Grey Market Fluke Tools

![How to avoid buying Grey Market Fluke Tools](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/grey-market-collage.png)

When you buy from an authorised Fluke distributor or directly from Fluke, you benefit from the original manufacturer’s warranty. Learn how to protect yourself from grey market products and counterfeit Fluke tools.

## What are Grey Market products?

Grey market products may be tools, parts, and/or accessories sold outside of a company’s authorised distribution channels. As these sales are unauthorised, the manufacturer is unable to guarantee that the products are authentic and therefore safe, meeting quality standards, or covered by the manufacturer’s warranty.

## Ensure your Fluke tools benefit from the manufacturer’s warranty

Customers should be aware that while Fluke products from grey market sellers may be genuine, these sellers may lack the capability to provide aftersales support and product training. Furthermore, customers take the risk that their purchases are not protected by the original manufacturer’s warranty.

Fluke tools enjoy the full benefit of an original manufacturer’s warranty, but this protection is only available when the tool is purchased through an authorised source. When it comes to electrical safety, your tools must perform to the highest standard. That’s why Fluke products not only comply with but exceed the requirements of IEC standards. When you buy from an authorised distributor, or directly through Fluke, you ensure that those safety standards and full manufacturer’s warranty are there for you.

Often, grey market sellers will pick up inventory from another source and resell it to make a profit. However, the warranty services provided by Fluke can only be obtained in the country the tool was originally purchased from Fluke or from a local authorised Fluke distributor or reseller.

Customers should be aware that only Fluke tools supplied by authorised distributors and resellers or directly from Fluke will be eligible for a product warranty, free-of-charge warranty repairs, and other services.

## How to spot a grey market seller

Recent advances with online shopping have made it easy for anyone to buy from online marketplaces, auction sites, or from sellers’ websites all over the world. These unauthorised resellers lead to grey market sales, or sales that circumvent the authorised distribution channels. These kinds of grey market sellers do not have a relationship with the original manufacturer of the tools since Fluke has not authorised these sellers.

There are many grey market sellers retailing Fluke products at artificially low prices. If the price appears too good, this lower price should raise a red flag that the tool may be grey market or possibly counterfeit.

As you’re shopping online, especially on websites that aggregate multiple sellers on one marketplace, double check where the seller is located and shipping from so you can be certain you are looking at genuine Fluke products being sold through one of our authorised distributors.

## Authorised distributors

To ensure you purchase a genuine Fluke product, buy online or through one of our authorised distributors. For an authorised Fluke partner near you, visit [https://www.fluke.com/en-au/where-to-buy](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/where-to-buy)

[Omniprésents dans les milieux industriels, les moteurs et les entraînements tombent parfois en panne. Cinq tests indispensables à ces systèmes pour prolonger la durée de vie des moteurs et économiser de l’énergie comprennent : inspection thermique, analyse des vibrations, alignement des arbres, résistance d’isolement et mesures électriques.](https://www.fluke.com/fr/apprendre/blog/moteurs-variateurs-pompes-compresseurs/13-causes-of-motor-failure)

[Les pinces mesurent le courant. Les sondes mesurent la tension. La mâchoire articulée intégrée d’un multimètre permet de placer le point de mesure sur un fil, un câble ou tout autre conducteur de circuit électrique, puis de mesurer le courant de ce circuit](https://www.fluke.com/fr/apprendre/blog/pinces/le-ba-ba-des-pinces-multimetres)

Heat recovery can increase energy efficiency by 30 percent or more. Cogeneration has garnered a lot of attention as a result, and sophisticated, almost  turnkey cogeneration solutions are now available in a range of sizes. “Let's just oversize the motor and we can run it lightly loaded—that will save us some money and be easier on the motor.” This is a false belief among some who select and install motors. Properly sizing motors for a given load results in driving loads more efficiently, saving energy, and saving dollars. Motors typically are most efficient when they are 90 % to 95 % loaded. Fluke News Plus Research Archive Articles

- ### [101 applications for laser distance meters](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/electrical/101-applications-for-laser-distance-meters)





The Fluke 416D and 411D laser distance meters measure distance to a target up to 60 m (200 ft) away using the unit's laser spot, and can do a quick calculation of area (square feet/meters) and volume. Accuracy is up to 1.5 mm (1/16 in).





**Article**

- ### [Understanding capacitive voltage sensors](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/electrical/understanding-capacitive-voltage-sensors)





The capacitive voltage sensor works because when you hold the barrel in your hand and place the tip near a live conductor, you are inserting the high impedance sensing element into a capacitively coupled series circuit. As your hand and body form a relatively large capacitor coupled to the floor. The sensor tip is a small capacitor coupled to the live voltage. The sensing circuit detects the voltage and turns on a light or sounds the buzzer.

To determine the existing equipment's capacity, factor in the incoming conductor size, the ratings of the equipment, and space for new circuits. To determine present loading, you'll need to either precisely calculate the existing loads, or measure them.





**Article**

- ### [Ensuring electrical circuit protection without nuisance tripping](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/electrical/ensuring-electrical-circuit-protection-without-nuisance-tripping)





Whether commercial, institutional, municipal, or industrial, sooner or later, nearly every facility will experience some type of overcurrent situation. Unless they're dealt with promptly, even modest overcurrent levels can cause system components to overheat and damage insulation, conductors, and equipment.





**Article**

- ### [Test and measurements for electrical fire prevention](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/electrical/test-and-measurements-for-electrical-fire-prevention)





For the most part industrial and commercial electrical systems are getting safer and more reliable. The U.S. Fire Administration's most recent report, analyzing data from 2001, estimates that 8.7% of the nation's 47,785 non-residential fires were caused by electrical distribution equipment. That's 32% fewer than in 1998.





**Article**

- ### [Case study: Efficient Tests Keep Fluorescent Lights Shining at Commercial Complex](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/electrical/efficient-tests-keep-fluorescent-lights-shining-at-commercial-complex)





Troubleshooting lights goes from minutes to seconds when using Fluke 1000FLT Light Tester for testing fluorescent light fixtures in a commercial complex





**Article**

- ### [Maintaining a solid ground](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/electrical/maintaining-a-solid-ground)





Properly grounding a facility's electrical system ensures a low impedance connection from the electrical system to the earth. However, the effectiveness of the earth ground depends on several factors.





**Article**

- ### [A million and one uses for voltage detectors](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/electrical/a-million-and-one-uses-for-voltage-detectors)





Voltage detectors are a quick, inexpensive way to check for the presence of live voltage on ac circuits, switches and outlets before working on them. Also known as voltage wands, sticks, "power sniffers" or pens, they clip into a shirt pocket and beep or glow when they detect voltage on exposed conducting parts or through insulation.





**Article**

- ### [Tough Places, Tough Tools](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/safety/tough-places-tough-tools)





Out on the job site, concrete finishers stand ready to shape wet ready-mix into a new stretch of highway. Mixer trucks are lined up at the concrete batch plant,waiting to take on their loads. But hold on—an electrical problem has shut down the plant. It's time to call Keithly Electric.





**Article**

- ### [Why You Care: Mixed Cabinet Electronics and Power](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/safety/why-you-care-mixed-cabinet-electronics-and-power)





Mixing higher voltage 480-volt three-phase cables in the same cabinet as lower voltage 24- or 120-volt control wiring and communication cabling can result in erratic operation or even complete failure of electronic equipment inside the cabinet. Knowing what is inside the cabinet before you open it, the specific wiring issues to look for once inside, what values to measure, and simple ways to correct problems can help alleviate many erratic and sometimes "mysterious" control and communication issues on the plant floor.





**Article**

- ### [Differences in voltage testers could be shocking](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/safety/differences-in-voltage-testers-could-be-shocking)





Thresholds between solenoid-based testers and electronic testers are markedly different and carry consequences for safety and convenience.





**Article**

- ### [Avoiding Incidents and Investigations Through Prevention and Protection](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/safety/avoiding-incidents-and-investigations-through-prevention-and-protection)





Avoiding incidents and investigations through prevention and protection





**Article**

- ### [How to Identify the Easiest Energy Savings in Your Facility](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/energy-efficiency/identify-energy-savings)





ROI for industrial energy efficiency programs. How manufacturing plants can identify energy waste, save on utilities, and industrial energy costs.





**Article**

- ### [Considering cogeneration?](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/energy-efficiency/considering-cogeneration)





Cogeneration - also known as combined heat and power or CHP - is the process of generating electricity and usable heat at the same time. The term has a modern, "green energy" ring to it, but cogeneration has been around since Edison's Pearl Street Station used heat from its turbines to warm the buildings of lower Manhattan in the 1880s.





**Article**

- ### [Find industrial energy waste](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/energy-efficiency/find-industrial-energy-waste-1)





With energy savings, there's intent and then there's plan. Industrial facilities in the United States show a sustained interest in energy management. That's the intent: Reduce overall energy usage or sustain usage but increase the amount produced per kW used.In manufacturing, a plan will only stick if it has both the wisdom of experience guiding the vision and the ROI numbers to back up the effort. But in energy, there just isn't the body of research out there for an industrial plant manager to use to set baselines for what "reasonable" energy usage looks like in a manufacturing facility.





**Article**

- ### [Energy auditing and weatherization with thermal imagers](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/energy-efficiency/energy-auditing-and-weatherization-with-thermal-imagers)





The first step in evaluating a building's energy use involves an energy audit. This consists of various home performance tests which identify opportunities to reduce energy use. Once the audit is complete, various weatherization techniques are performed to improve the energy efficiency of the building, often called 'weatherizing'.





**Article**

- ### [Fluke developing smart grid technology](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/energy-efficiency/fluke-developing-smart-grid-technology)





You may have read about the new Smart Grid currently in development by various manufacturers, utilities and government agencies worldwide. At the highest level, the idea behind the Smart Grid is to add far more "intelligent" devices to the transmission of high voltage across a large power grid such as the continental U.S.





**Article**

- ### [How to calculate the payback of test tools](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/energy-efficiency/how-to-calculate-the-payback-of-test-tools)





Now that budgets and staff are smaller, it's not uncommon for management to ask for justification before authorizing tool purchases. The key phrase here is return on investment (ROI), or how long will it take to save enough money, using the tool, to cover the cost of purchasing the tool.





**Article**

- ### [Case study: Texas power consultant keeps uninterruptible power supplies up and running](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/power-quality/texas-power-consultant-keeps-uninterruptible-power-supplies-up-and-running)





Critical systems run smoothly with regular maintenance and reliable tools Everybody knows that consistent, dependable electrical power is critical to any plant's function. But perhaps even more critical is a reliable uninterruptible power supply (UPS) system. UPS systems are the silent partners that just sit and wait until there's a break in power. At that point, the UPS system is the most important system in the plant. It has to be ready to spring into action in milliseconds to keeps things running for anywhere from seconds to hours.





**Article**

- ### [Seven steps to mitigate VFD harmonic issues](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/power-quality/seven-steps-to-mitigate-vfd-harmonic-issues)





To determine the best solution for mitigating unwanted harmonics, start by investigating the equipment suspected of producing the bulk of the harmonic currents. Most often these are Variable Frequency Drives (VFD's). Use measuring equipment to measure and analyze the frequencies and amplitudes of the harmonics. This is much simpler than it sounds.





**Article**

- ### [Case study: A hospital tech develops his power quality knowledge](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/power-quality/a-hospital-tech-develops-his-power-quality-knowledge)





Downtime is costly, both in terms of patient wellbeing and monetary costs - the X-Ray, mammography, and other systems themselves cost millions and a failure can also idle technicians or surgical teams. Most of the facilities have motor/generators and can maintain operations independent of the utility, making the power system robust but also complex.





**Article**

- ### [Reliable backup power](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/power-quality/reliable-backup-power)





Since information technology (IT) installations are particularly sensitive to power supply fluctuations and distortions, they typically rely on an uninterruptible power supply (UPS) to compensate. Some installations even include a second UPS supplied by a separate feeder, and a standby generator that can be set to start automatically three minutes after detecting a power interruption.





**Article**

- ### [Troubleshooting power factor correction capacitors](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/power-quality/troubleshooting-power-factor-correction-capacitors)





Power factor correction capacitors reduce energy costs by avoiding the premium rates that utilities charge when power factor falls below specified values.





**Article**

- ### [Electrical Panel Overheating for No Apparent Reason?](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/power-quality/troubleshooting-electrical-panel-overheating-problem)





Troubleshooting an electrical panel overheating problem from unusual causes; testing with the power on, ruling out harmonics—and the resolution.





**Article**

- ### [Practical applications for single-phase voltage recording](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/power-quality/practical-applications-for-single-phase-voltage-recording)





Voltage stability may be a problem in areas where loads are cycling on and off during the day. Large compressors, motors, welding machines, arc furnaces, power factor correction capacitors and other large electrical machinery along with system impedance can easily cause voltage dips, swells, and transients.





**Article**

- ### [Five problems you will never uncover with a digital multimeter](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/oscilloscopes/five-problems-you-will-never-uncover-with-a-digital-multimeter)





The importance of investing in the right set of tools to monitor power quality issues, and prevent them in the future, can't be emphasized enough. Fluke offers an extensive range of excellent power meters and other power quality tools for troubleshooting, preventive maintenance, and long-term recording and analysis in industrial applications and utilities.





**Article**

- ### [Foundation™ Fieldbus: System and diagnostic basics](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/oscilloscopes/foundation-fieldbus-system-and-diagnostic-basics)





The current trend in factory automation is to replace traditional control schemes in which each device has its own control wiring with bus systems that link a number of devices via the same cable. One benefit of bus networks is that they require far fewer cables and wires to connect devices to controllers. One of the most popular and widely used of these bus systems is Foundation Fieldbus.





**Article**

- ### [Hybrid vehicle measurement safety basics: Taking high-voltage readings](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/automotive/hybrid-vehicle-measurement-safety-basics-taking-high-voltage-readings)





Hybrid vehicle technology may be in its infancy, but the field is growing rapidly. Every major auto and truck manufacturer is developing hybrids, and hybrid technology is a stepping-stone to advanced electric-drive components that will be used in both hydrogen fuel cell vehicles and pure electric vehicles.





**Article**

- ### [Tools for testing electronic circuits](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/oscilloscopes/testing-electronic-circuits)





Since its introduction nearly 40 years ago, the 555 timer IC and its companion 556 dual timer have inspired hobbyists, technicians, inventors, engineers, and many others who love to experiment with electronic circuits. An Internet search on "555 timer" yields millions of hits. Using "555 timer projects" as the search phrase yields more than 800,000 hits.





**Article**

- ### [Evaluating relative humidity: Key factors and measurements](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/hvac/evaluating-relative-humidity-key-factors-and-measurements)





Understanding the relationship between dry bulb temperature, wet bulb temperature, relative humidity, and dew point temperature is essential in all facets of air conditioning. These psychrometric processes play an especially important role in building and materials integrity, occupant health and comfort, and overall indoor air quality.





**Article**

- ### [Diagnosing mold problems](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/hvac/diagnosing-mold-problems)





One of the possible problems in facilities today is the presence and effects of mold on the indoor environment. Molds are normally present in nature. They reproduce by means of tiny spores that float through the air and are invisible to the naked eye. They can grow on wood, paper, carpet, foods, and insulation - but none of the many types of mold will grow without water or moisture. When excessive moisture accumulates in buildings or on building materials, mold growth will often occur, particularly if the moisture problem remains unaddressed.





**Article**

- ### [Insulation resistance and electrical testing for HVAC compressor motors](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/hvac/insulation-resistance-and-electrical-testing-for-hvac-compressor-motors)





HVACR mechanics rarely rely on a single test to pass or fail a function or process. As they walk up to a condensing unit, they listen, they wave their hand over the condenser discharge air, and then they grab the suction line, the liquid line, and the discharge line (and wish they hadn't done that). All of this before they even open their tool box.





**Article**

- ### [When start-up inspections pay off for HVAC](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/hvac/when-start-up-inspections-pay-off-for-hvac)





After years of being a serviceman - slinging ladders, dragging tools across attics and through crawlspaces, standing in all sorts of weather on rooftops - I can now leave the service work to one of the younger techs with better knees and concentrate on my primary job as company start-up man.





**Article**

- ### [Troubleshooting web-based HVAC control system networks](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/hvac/troubleshooting-web-based-hvac-control-system-networks)





Scenarios showing how to prevent system failures and downtime caused by HVAC network problems.





**Article**

- ### [My chiller plant is down, do you know how incredibly critical it is?](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/hvac/my-chiller-plant-is-down)





If chilled water flow is interrupted for even a few minutes the IT server room might overheat and critical computer services could go down. Another vital area is a hospital operating room. In a plant, essential machinery uses chilled water for process cooling. While many plants have excess capacity, much of this capacity is not available at high ambient temperature and high humidity conditions.





**Article**

- ### [Powerful new 2-channel handheld oscilloscopes](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/oscilloscopes/powerful-new-2-channel-handheld-oscilloscopes)





Fluke ScopeMeter®190 Series II, 2-channel handheld oscilloscopes combine the power of a 2-channel oscilloscope with a 5000-count digital multimeter and paperless recording mode, creating an advanced test and measurement tool that service and maintenance professionals can rely on for troubleshooting equipment performance problems in the field





**Article**

- ### [ABCs of Portable Oscilloscopes: Part 5, Capturing intermittent and random events with a portable oscilloscope](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/oscilloscopes/abcs-of-portable-oscilloscopes-part-5-capturing-intermittent-and-random-events-with-a-portable-oscilloscope)





This final installment of the five-part series about using portable oscilloscopes covers how to "capture" waveforms that do not occur in a repeating and predictable way. You can view Part 4 of this series, Capturing and Analyzing Waveforms with a Portable Oscilloscope. You can also view the complete webinar with audio and animations at the Fluke Training Center.





**Article**

- ### [ABCs of Portable Oscilloscopes: Part 3, Triggering and isolation](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/oscilloscopes/abcs-of-portable-oscilloscopes-part-3-triggering-and-isolation)





Part 3 of this five-part series describes how to trigger an oscilloscope so it displays a signal the way you want, and how the oscilloscope's inputs are isolated. You can view the preceding installment of this series, Signal Input and Processing. You can also view the complete webinar with audio and animations at the Fluke Training Center.





**Article**

- ### [ABCs of Portable Oscilloscopes: Part 4, Capturing and analyzing waveforms](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/oscilloscopes/abcs-of-portable-oscilloscopes-part-4-capturing-and-analyzing-waveforms)





Part 4 of this five-part series describes capturing and analyzing waveforms with a portable oscilloscope, answering that key question, "How do I know if a waveform is good or bad?". You can view Part 3 of this series, Triggering and Isolation. You can also view the complete webinar with audio and animations at the Fluke Training Center.





**Article**

- ### [Boiler maintenance and troubleshooting best practices](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/learn/blog/hvac/boiler-maintenance-and-troubleshooting-best-practices)





Boilers and their associated systems are an important part of a modern commercial building's central energy plant. Prevent costly downtime and expensive equipment failures.





**Article**

- ### [Fluke Norma Upgrade 4000/5000 Software](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/support/software-downloads/fluke-norma-upgrade-4000-5000-software)





Some Norma 4000 and 5000 instruments require attention due to a calibration error of the external probe (EXT.Shunt- BNC) inputs of instruments caused by incorrect data being written into the instrument at production.This error only affects the current probe inputs of the instruments in the 100mV range and only specific serial numbers (you will have been contacted by Fluke if this affects you).Please follow the steps below to fix the calibration data for all customers if you have been contacted to...





**Article**

- ### [Fluke 1750 Three-Phase Power Recorder Software and Firmware](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/support/software-downloads/fluke-1750-three-phase-power-recorder-software-and-firmware)





Fluke 1750 Firmware Update v23.06 (.exe) Last updated 12/2014Release Notes for 1750 Firmware 23.06 (.pdf)Important notes on changes and fixes to Fluke 1750 firmware.Fluke Power Analyze Software v2.4 (.exe)FPA Application software, uninstall old version before installing this new version. Last updated 04/2013Power View PDA Software v1.47 for iPaq (.exe)Application software for use with HP PDA onlyPower View Android Application Software v2.0.20 (.zip)Android application software, follow installation...





**Article**

- ### [FlukeView® for CombiScopes® Software](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/support/software-downloads/flukeview-combiscopes-software)





Tune up the performance of your CombiScope®. Add PC power with FlukeView® CombiScope® software for Windows.This is a Windows package for documenting, archiving and analyzing measurements from the Fluke CombiScope. Toolbar buttons give fast mouse access to the most commonly-occurring tasks and functions.Free Demo Software! Free upgrade to version 2.0!Download the free CombiScope Interactive Demonstration Software. If you currently have FlukeView CombiScope version 1.0 or 1.1 installed on your PC,...





**Article**

- ### [Fluke 287 and 289 Multimeter Firmware Update](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/support/software-downloads/fluke-287-and-289-multimeter-firmware-update)





Fluke 287 multimeters beginning with serial number 42700001 and Fluke 289 multimeters beginning with serial number 42830001 ship with firmware version 1.41. Older versions of the Fluke 287 or 289 with lower serial numbers cannot be upgraded to version 1.41Fluke 287 Firmware update version 1.16Owners of Fluke 287 multimeters with serial number 42700000 or LOWER can update to firmware version 1.16. These multimeters are NOT upgradable to any firmware higher than 1.16.To upgrade your 287 to the latest...





**Article**

- ### [FlukeView® Forms Software Updates](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/support/software-downloads/fluke-view-forms-software-updates)





FlukeView Forms Basic 3.8.4 (.exe)FlukeView Forms plus Designer 3.8.4 (.exe)Fluke 975 USB Drivers 1.5.0.22 (.zip)FlukeView Forms Software.Anyone with FlukeView Forms version 3.0 or later can receive a free software update by clicking the links and downloading the software from this site. Basic users would select the "Basic" link and users with the complete package would select the "plus Designer" link. If your present FlukeView Forms software is older than version 3.0 (less than 3.0) you must purchase...





**Article**

# Thank you for registering your product

Please contact the Fluke Service Organization or the distributor in your country for instructions for the return of your ‘Affected Product’ for a free repair of your product. For contact details please visit this page: https://www.fluke.com/en/where-to-buy. Please provide your own shipping container (packages that have hazardous material or dangerous goods warnings should not be used). Your repaired product will be returned to your shipping address.

If you have more than 20 units, please fill out another form.

Cogeneration has garnered a lot of attention as a result, and sophisticated, almost  turnkey cogeneration solutions are now available in a range of sizes. - ### [101 applications for laser distance meters](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/101-applications-for-laser-distance-meters)

**Article**

- ### [Understanding capacitive voltage sensors](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/understanding-capacitive-voltage-sensors)





The capacitive voltage sensor works because when you hold the barrel in your hand and place the tip near a live conductor, you are inserting the high impedance sensing element into a capacitively coupled series circuit. As your hand and body form a relatively large capacitor coupled to the floor. The sensor tip is a small capacitor coupled to the live voltage. The sensing circuit detects the voltage and turns on a light or sounds the buzzer.

- ### [Safety considerations for live measurements: keep your eyes on the job at hand](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/safety-considerations-for-live-measurements-keep-your-eyes-on-the-job-at-hand)





Measuring live voltages and current in today's high energy environments can result in a severe hazard to equipment and users if proper precautions are not applied. Given the risk of transients, surges, and old-fashioned human error, it always pays to follow safe work practices and use test instruments rated for the voltage or current you're measuring.





**Article**

- ### [30 day load studies with the Fluke 1735 Power Logger](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/30-day-load-studies-with-the-fluke-1735-power-logger)





To determine the existing equipment's capacity, factor in the incoming conductor size, the ratings of the equipment, and space for new circuits. To determine present loading, you'll need to either precisely calculate the existing loads, or measure them.





**Article**

- ### [Ensuring electrical circuit protection without nuisance tripping](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/ensuring-electrical-circuit-protection-without-nuisance-tripping)





Whether commercial, institutional, municipal, or industrial, sooner or later, nearly every facility will experience some type of overcurrent situation. Unless they're dealt with promptly, even modest overcurrent levels can cause system components to overheat and damage insulation, conductors, and equipment.





**Article**

- ### [Test and measurements for electrical fire prevention](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/test-and-measurements-for-electrical-fire-prevention)





For the most part industrial and commercial electrical systems are getting safer and more reliable. The U.S. Fire Administration's most recent report, analyzing data from 2001, estimates that 8.7% of the nation's 47,785 non-residential fires were caused by electrical distribution equipment. That's 32% fewer than in 1998.





**Article**

- ### [Case study: Efficient Tests Keep Fluorescent Lights Shining at Commercial Complex](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/efficient-tests-keep-fluorescent-lights-shining-at-commercial-complex)





Troubleshooting lights goes from minutes to seconds when using Fluke 1000FLT Light Tester for testing fluorescent light fixtures in a commercial complex





**Article**

- ### [Maintaining a solid ground](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/maintaining-a-solid-ground)





Properly grounding a facility's electrical system ensures a low impedance connection from the electrical system to the earth. However, the effectiveness of the earth ground depends on several factors.





**Article**

- ### [A million and one uses for voltage detectors](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/electrical/a-million-and-one-uses-for-voltage-detectors)





Voltage detectors are a quick, inexpensive way to check for the presence of live voltage on ac circuits, switches and outlets before working on them. Also known as voltage wands, sticks, "power sniffers" or pens, they clip into a shirt pocket and beep or glow when they detect voltage on exposed conducting parts or through insulation.





**Article**

- ### [Tough Places, Tough Tools](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/safety/tough-places-tough-tools)





Out on the job site, concrete finishers stand ready to shape wet ready-mix into a new stretch of highway. Mixer trucks are lined up at the concrete batch plant,waiting to take on their loads. But hold on—an electrical problem has shut down the plant. It's time to call Keithly Electric.





**Article**

- ### [Why You Care: Mixed Cabinet Electronics and Power](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/safety/why-you-care-mixed-cabinet-electronics-and-power)





Mixing higher voltage 480-volt three-phase cables in the same cabinet as lower voltage 24- or 120-volt control wiring and communication cabling can result in erratic operation or even complete failure of electronic equipment inside the cabinet. Knowing what is inside the cabinet before you open it, the specific wiring issues to look for once inside, what values to measure, and simple ways to correct problems can help alleviate many erratic and sometimes "mysterious" control and communication issues on the plant floor.





**Article**

- ### [Differences in voltage testers could be shocking](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/safety/differences-in-voltage-testers-could-be-shocking)





Thresholds between solenoid-based testers and electronic testers are markedly different and carry consequences for safety and convenience.

Avoiding incidents and investigations through prevention and protection

ROI for industrial energy efficiency programs. How manufacturing plants can identify energy waste, save on utilities, and industrial energy costs.

Cogeneration - also known as combined heat and power or CHP - is the process of generating electricity and usable heat at the same time. The term has a modern, "green energy" ring to it, but cogeneration has been around since Edison's Pearl Street Station used heat from its turbines to warm the buildings of lower Manhattan in the 1880s.





**Article**

- ### [Find industrial energy waste](https://www.fluke.com/en/learn/blog/energy-efficiency/find-industrial-energy-waste-1)





With energy savings, there's intent and then there's plan. Industrial facilities in the United States show a sustained interest in energy management. That's the intent: Reduce overall energy usage or sustain usage but increase the amount produced per kW used.In manufacturing, a plan will only stick if it has both the wisdom of experience guiding the vision and the ROI numbers to back up the effort. But in energy, there just isn't the body of research out there for an industrial plant manager to use to set baselines for what "reasonable" energy usage looks like in a manufacturing facility.

Critical systems run smoothly with regular maintenance and reliable tools Everybody knows that consistent, dependable electrical power is critical to any plant's function. But perhaps even more critical is a reliable uninterruptible power supply (UPS) system. UPS systems are the silent partners that just sit and wait until there's a break in power. At that point, the UPS system is the most important system in the plant. It has to be ready to spring into action in milliseconds to keeps things running for anywhere from seconds to hours.

Since information technology (IT) installations are particularly sensitive to power supply fluctuations and distortions, they typically rely on an uninterruptible power supply (UPS) to compensate. They can grow on wood, paper, carpet, foods, and insulation - but none of the many types of mold will grow without water or moisture. Critical systems run smoothly with regular maintenance and reliable tools Everybody knows that consistent, dependable electrical power is critical to any plant's function. But perhaps even more critical is a reliable uninterruptible power supply (UPS) system. UPS systems are the silent partners that just sit and wait until there's a break in power. At that point, the UPS system is the most important system in the plant. It has to be ready to spring into action in milliseconds to keeps things running for anywhere from seconds to hours.

# Chat Coupon Code Terms and Conditions

Print and Share this Coupon Code with your Distributor Partner or use Code on Fluke.com

**FLK2024-Q2CHAT**

COUPON TERMS AND CONDITIONS: Sponsored by Fluke Electronics Corporation, 6920 Seaway Boulevard, Everett, WA. Discount is available for purchases of a “Qualifying Fluke/Fluke Networks/PLS/Amprobe Purchase” from a participating authorized Fluke distributor in the United States. Offer is not transferable, may not be reproduced, may not be redeemed for cash and has no cash value, and is only valid until June 30th, 2024.

### End customer qualifications -

- Purchase must be made by June 30th, 2024
- Cannot be combined with any other discounts or offers or any additional Fluke programs, including but not limited to free gift with purchase promotions
- End customer must independently verify distributor is participating in this incentive program.
- Limit 1 use per customer

### Distributor Qualifications

- All Fluke, Fluke Networks, Amprobe and PLS products are eligible
- Drop Ship to End-User Purchase Order is required
- Cannot combine with Joint Sales Call Program
- Not applicable in combination with any Special Pricing Agreements

### Fluke.com Instructions

Select the Promo Code in Shopping Cart and complete order.

### Distributor Instructions

1. Retrieve new net pricing from your Fluke rep via email
2. Submit PO to Fluke with qualifying items noting the promo code ‘ **FLK2024-Q2CHAT**’ on the order and identifying the end user drop ship name and address.
3. PO will be invoiced to distributor with the additional discount applied to their net contract price and drop shipped directly to the specified end-customer address. (Note the drop ship fee is waived.)

[https://www.fluke.com/en-us/where-to-buy](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/where-to-buy)

### FLUKE Discount Code Offer Terms & Conditions

1. **Code Description**

Eligible end customers who participate in this Discount Code Offer (the “Code Offer”) during the Code Offer Period (as defined in Section 3) and meet all the requirements as set forth in these terms and conditions of the Code Offer are eligible to receive a discount as further described below.

Under the Code Offer, eligible end customers of Fluke, Fluke Networks, Amprobe, and Pacific Laser Systems, which are divisions of Fluke Electronics Corporation and Fluke Electronics Limited Partnership (“Sponsor”), who purchase “Qualifying Fluke Products” (as defined below) from Sponsor, authorized distributor, or authorized reseller during the Code Offer Period will receive a Discount as detailed below. See the list of authorized distributors at [https://www.fluke.com/en-us/where-to-buy](https://www.fluke.com/en-us/where-to-buy).

For purposes of this Code Offer, the term “Qualifying Fluke Products” means only Fluke, Fluke Networks, Amprobe, and Pacific Laser Systems products. The discount allowed is equal to 10%.

2. **Eligibility**

For purposes of the Promotion, a customer must be at least 18 years of age, and a resident of the 50 United States or District of Columbia (excluding Guam, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands and all other U.S. territories and possessions).

Only customers that are end-users and use the Qualifying Fluke Products for their own purposes are eligible to participate in the Code Offer. Distributors, resellers, and similar parties are expressly excluded from directly participating in the Code Offer when not drop shipping to end-user.

Employees, directors and officers of the Sponsor, its parent companies, affiliated companies, subsidiaries, distributors, representatives, and those persons’ immediate families (parents, siblings, children, and spouse) and persons living in the same household (whether related or not) are not eligible to participate in the Code Offer. Further, no employees, officers, directors, representatives, or agents of (i) government entities, including government owned or controlled companies, (ii) distributors or (iii) competing tool manufacturers are eligible to participate in the Code Offer.

3. **Instructions on How to Participate in the Code Offer**

End customers must present Discount Code to an authorized Fluke distributor or reseller. Authorized Fluke distributor or reseller will modify existing Fluke product quote to indicated discount. Authorized Fluke distributors and resellers are not obligated to honor the Discount Code. End customers must independently verify that their preferred distributor will participate in the Code Offer.

4. **Code Offer Period**

In order to qualify for the Discount Code, an eligible end customer must purchase Qualifying Fluke Products by June 30, 2024.

5. **Restrictions and Limitations of the Code Offer**

The Code Offer is subject to all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations and is void where prohibited by law.

The discount available under this Code Offer may not be combined with any other discounts, codes, credits, rebates, or other special offers from the Sponsor applicable to the purchase of a Qualifying Fluke Product.

**All costs, taxes, customs duties, fees, and expenses associated with a customer’s participation in the Code Offer are the responsibility of the customer.**

6. **Disclaimer**

Sponsor and each of its parent companies, subsidiaries, and affiliates, and each of their respective directors, officers, equity owners, professional advisors, distributors, representatives, employees and agents (collectively, the “Released Parties”) will not be responsible or have any liability for: (a) any late, lost, misrouted, garbled or distorted or damaged communications, transmissions or requests; (b) telephone, electronic, hardware, software, network, Internet, or other computer- or communications-related malfunctions or failures; (c) any Code Offer disruptions, injuries, losses or damages caused by events beyond the control of Sponsor or by non-authorized human or other intervention; or (d) any printing or typographical errors in any materials associated with the Code Offer.

Sponsor and the Released Parties are not responsible for: (a) authorized distributors that do not participate in the Code Offer; (b) participating authorized distributors that sell products at the price they determine; or (c) participating authorized distributors mishandling transactions and/or shipments of product.

7. **Limitation of Liability**

Except where otherwise prohibited by law, by participating in the Code Offer, you release and agree to indemnify and hold harmless each Released Party from any liability, obligation, injury, claim, suit, action, cost, expense, loss or damage of any kind, including any tax liability or loss of opportunity, whether direct, indirect, special, incidental or consequential, that may be imposed on, asserted against or incurred by such Released Party that arise out of or relate in any way to this Code Offer and the gifts offered hereunder, including, but not limited to, where arising out of or relating to the following: (a) any technical difficulties or equipment malfunction (whether or not under Sponsor’s control); (b) any theft, unauthorized access or third party interference; (c) any redemption request that is late, lost, altered, damaged or misdirected (whether or not after their receipt by Sponsor, and whether or not in Sponsor’s control); (d) any damages due to the operation of the postal service; (e) any variation in Code Offer value to that stated in these terms and conditions; (f) any tax liability incurred by participant; or (g) use or misuse of the products offered under the Code Offer.

8. **Miscellaneous**

The Code Offer and these terms and conditions will be governed, construed, and interpreted under the laws of the State of Washington, USA without applying any conflicts or choice of law provisions under such law that might refer the construction or interpretation of any term hereof to the laws of any other jurisdiction. Any action brought regarding the Code Offer and these terms and conditions may only be brought in the state or federal courts located in the State of Washington, and each party to such action expressly consents to jurisdiction of those courts. If any provision of these terms and conditions is held illegal or unenforceable in a judicial proceeding, such provision shall be severed and shall be inoperative, and, provided that the fundamental terms and conditions of these terms and conditions remain legal and enforceable, the remainder of these terms and conditions shall remain operative and binding.

The customer is bound by these terms and conditions and by the decisions of Sponsor, which are final and binding in all respects. To the extent permitted by law, Sponsor reserves the right to change these terms and conditions at any time, in its sole and absolute discretion, and to suspend or cancel the Code Offer or any customer’s participation in the Code Offer should technical failures, computer viruses, fraud, human error, unauthorized human intervention or other causes beyond Sponsor’s control affect the administration, security, proper functioning, integrity or conduct of the Code Offer, Sponsor otherwise becomes (as determined in its sole and absolute discretion) incapable of conducting the Code Offer as planned, or for any other reason determined by Sponsor to be appropriate in its sole and absolute discretion.

These terms and conditions constitute the entire agreement governing the Code Offer and binding the customer, and no other agreement, verbal or otherwise, shall be binding regarding the Code Offer unless it is in writing and signed by Sponsor. In case of any conflict or inconsistency between any other documents relating to the Code Offer and these terms and conditions, these terms and conditions shall control. To the maximum extent provided by law, no waiver of any provision of these terms and conditions will be implied from any course of dealings between the customer and Sponsor or from any failure by the customer or Sponsor to assert its rights hereunder on any occasion or a series of occasions. Eligibility to participate in the Code Offer is non-transferable and non-assignable.

Any customer who violates these terms and conditions, violates any law, rule or regulation in connection with participation in the Code Offer, tampers with the operation of the Code Offer, or engages in any conduct that is unsportsmanlike, disruptive, or detrimental or unfair to Sponsor, the Code Offer or any other participant (in each case as determined in Sponsor’s sole and absolute discretion) are subject to disqualification from participation in the Code Offer and all other rights and remedies available under the law.

Sponsor’s use of the customer’s personal information provided to Sponsor is subject to Sponsor's Privacy Policy (available at http://en-us.fluke.com/site/privacy). If you have any questions about these terms and conditions or the Code Offer, please email them to fluke-info@fluke.com or send written questions to the address: 6920 Seaway Blvd., Everett, WA 98203.

9. **Sponsor’s Address Information**

Fluke Electronics Corporation: 6920 Seaway, Blvd., Everett, WA 98203. Fluke Electronics Limited Partnership: 400 Britannia Rd E, Unit 1, Mississauga, L4Z 1X9.

10. **Copyright Notice**

The Code Offer and all accompanying materials, including these terms and conditions, are copyright © 2024 by Fluke Corporation. All rights reserved.

# Fluke 700HPPK/700HPM Recall

Dear Customer,

Thank you for registering your product(s) as part of our product safety recall of your Fluke 700HPPK/700HPM.

We will soon be sending you a cable replacement to correct your Recalled Cable(s). A Fluke representative may contact you shortly if more information is needed.

Measure and record up to 65,000 readings wirelessly - Easier wire access around large conductors in tight spaces - Inrush function; magnetic hanging strap [Download the product manual](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#) [![Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex 1a](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/F-a3001fc_01a_c_0.jpg)Fluke a3001 FC](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc "Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex 1a") [![Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex® AC Current Clamp Kit](https://dam-assets.fluke.com/s3fs-public/flukeig/products/images/clamps/jpeg/f-3000fc-ac-current-iflex-01a-1500x1000.jpg)Fluke a3001 iFlex/Meter Kit](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc-kit "Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex® AC Current Clamp Kit") In stock A$528.00 Tax included where applicable Genuine Fluke Product Free shipping [See all models](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#) Add to Cart -Decrement+Increment [Find a distributor](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/where-to-buy?from=fluke-a3001-fc) - [Product overview](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#overview-tab) - [Specifications](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#specs-tab) - [Models](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#models-tab) - [Reviews + Q&A](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#reviews-tab) - [Manuals + resources](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#resources-tab) - [Compatible accessories](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/product/electrical-testing/clamp-meters/fluke-a3001-fc#accordion-access-tab) ## Product overview: Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex® AC Current Module ## Product Overview: Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex® AC Current Module The Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex AC Current Module is a fully functional true-rms current meter that wirelessly relays measurements to the Fluke Connect® mobile app. The a3001 puts the tool, not your body, near live electrical panels. Connect the a3001 FC current module and read the results on your smartphone from a safe distance. You can save and share measurements from the field with your team anytime, from anywhere. ### Isolating intermittent electrical faults easily Leave your a3001 connected to log measurements and walk away to address other issues. Download the data for further analysis on our phone. Record over time to monitor circuit load changes for an hour, a shift or a week. Use the Fluke Connect wireless USB adapter to collect logged data from remote modules by walking past a working module and downloading logged data. ### Faster and cheaper 3-phase testing When your cabinet is de-energized, attach a Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex AC Current Module to each phase. Close, re-energize and start taking readings in 1/3 of the time. What used to take hours and use costly equipment can be done in minutes with an affordable Fluke Connect wireless system. ### Log, analyze, and diagnose easily You can solve problems faster by seeing live measurements from multiple test points on a single screen. Send data from the panel to your laptop and go from logging to analysis and diagnosis with the a3001 connected. Once you’ve gathered the measurements, you can perform for analysis with your PC and share the results using Fluke Cloud™ storage and ShareLive™ video call. Share and view data or graphs to get input from team members. ### What's in the box: - a3001 Flexible Current Clamp Meter - iFlex i2500-10 Flexible Current Probe - Quick Reference Guide ## Specifications: Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex® AC Current Module | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | Specifications | | Range | 0.5 A to 2500 A AC | | Resolution | 0.1 A | | Accuracy | 3% ± 5 digits (5 Hz to 500 Hz) | | Crest factor (50 Hz/60 Hz) | 3.0 at 1100 A
2.5 at 1400 A
1.42 at 2500 A
Add 2% for C.F. > 2 | | LCD w/backlight | 3½ digits | | Log rate/interval | 1 sec minimum/adjustable by PC or front panel | | Battery type | 2 AA, NEDA 15 A, IEC LR6 | | Battery life | 400 hours | | Memory | Record up to 65,000 readings | | RF communications | 2.4 GHZ ISM Band | | RF communication range | **Open air, unobstructed** | Up to 20 m | | Obstructed, sheetrock wall | Up to 6.5 m | | Obstructed, concrete wall or steel electrical enclosure | Up to 3.5 m | | Operating temperature | -10°C to +50°C | | Storage temperature | -40°C to +60°C | | Temperature coefficient | Add 0.1 X (specified accuracy) / °C (< 18°C or > 28°C) | | Operating humidity | 90% at 35°C
75% at 40°C
45% at 50°C | | Altitude | **Operating** | 2,000 m | | Storage | 12,000 m | | EMC | EN 61326-1:2006 | | Safety compliance | IEC 61010-1, 600 V CAT IV/1000 V CAT III, 3rd edition | | Safety rating | CAT IV 600 V, CAT III 1000 V | | Certifications | CSA, CE, FCC: T68-FBLE IC: 6627A-FBLE | | Ingress Protection (IP) rating | IP42 | | Pollution Degree | 2 | | Jaw opening | 25.4 cm (10 in) coil | | Size (HxWxD) | 16.5 cm x 6.35 cm x 1.4 cm (6.5 in x 2.5 in x 1.4 in) | | Weight | .22 kg (8 oz) | | Warranty | Three years | | Note: Not compatible with Fluke CNX test tools | ## Models: Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex® AC Current Module FLK-a3001FC Fluke a3001 FC Wireless iFlex® AC Current Module [Find a distributor](https://www.fluke.com/en-au/where-to-buy?from=fluke-a3001-fc) Includes: -
